inject: A conspiracy theory goes viral, claiming NATO is secretly installing surveillance equipment in civilian infrastructure under the guise of the exercise.

filter.intro: Conspiracy narrative. Low bot amplification but long time active - organic spread. True believers driving this, not bots. Difficult.
filter.outro: Conspiracy theories resist fact-checking - believers dismiss evidence as 'what they want you to think.' Counter-narrative works better - transparency, open facilities, invite inspection. Pre-bunking excellent if you inoculated against surveillance paranoia. Discrediting conspiracy theorists? Almost always backfires - creates martyrs. Ignoring is very dangerous - lets theory metastasize.

metadata.teachingPoint: Conspiracies require transparency and engagement, not aggressive debunking
